intro: Xylorhiza lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf woodspurge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in the summer. Xylorhiza lanceolata typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
